SEARCH:
Package game.AI.Utils

Klasse CardEvaluation

java.lang.Object
game.AI.Utils.CardEvaluation
public class CardEvaluation extends Object
The CardEvaluation class provides static helper methods for evaluating cards in the card game Hearts.

  • Methodendetails

    • checkPassedCardsForStM

      public static boolean checkPassedCardsForStM(List<Card> passedCards)
      Checks if the cards passed by a player indicate an attempt to "Shoot the Moon". This method examines the list of passed cards and looks for indicators that the player might be attempting to "Shoot the Moon". Specifically, it checks if high cards, heart cards, and the Queen of Spades are absent, as passing such cards could jeopardize the attempt.
      Parameter:
      passedCards - the list of cards that have been passed by the player
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the passed cards indicate an attempt to "Shoot the Moon"; false otherwise.

    • getBestCard

      public static int getBestCard(int[] cardScore)
      Determines the highest scoring card from an array of card scores. This method iterates through the provided array, which contains the scores for each card, and identifies the card with the highest score. The card scores typically represent the strategic value of each card in the context of the game, with a higher score indicating a more advantageous card.
      Parameter:
      cardScore - an array of integers representing the scores for each card, where the array index corresponds to the card ID minus one (array index 0 corresponds to card 1).
      Gibt zurück:
      the card ID of the highest-rated card in the array. In case of multiple cards with the same highest score, the first encountered card is returned.

    • getPlaybleCards

      public static ArrayList<Card> getPlaybleCards(HandCards currentHandCards)
      Creates a list of all playable cards from a player's hand cards. This method goes through all possible cards in the standard 52-card deck and adds each card that is in the player's hand to the list of playable cards.
      Parameter:
      currentHandCards - The current hand cards of the player.
      Gibt zurück:
      A ArrayList<Card> containing all playable cards of the player.

    • calculatePlayedCards

      public static boolean[] calculatePlayedCards(Trick[] allTricks, int tricksToConsider, int tricksPlayed)
      Creates an array of boolean values indicating which cards from the deck have already been played. This method goes through the tricks played so far and marks each played card in the array `cardsPlayed`. Each element in the boolean array `cardsPlayed` is set to `true` if the corresponding card has already been played. This information can be used to make decisions in the game based on the cards that have already been played.
      Parameter:
      allTricks - Array of `Trick` objects representing all tricks played so far.
      tricksToConsider - From which trick onwards the played cards should be considered.
      tricksPlayed - How many tricks have been played so far, defining the upper bound of the loop.
      deckSize - The size of the deck, defining the length of the returned boolean array.
      Gibt zurück:
      A boolean array indicating whether each card position in the deck has been played.

    • calculateAvailableCards

      public static boolean[] calculateAvailableCards(boolean[] cardsPlayed, HandCards handCards)
      Determines an array of boolean values indicating which cards from the deck are still available. This method compares the given array of played cards (`cardsPlayed`) and the cards on hand (`handCards`) to determine which cards have not yet been played and are also not on hand. Each element in the boolean array `cardsAvailable` is set to `true` if the corresponding card is still available.
      Parameter:
      cardsPlayed - A boolean array indicating whether each card in the deck has been played already.
      handCards - The hand cards of the player, used to check which cards are still available.
      Gibt zurück:
      A boolean array indicating which cards have not been played and are not in hand.

    • isHighCard

      public static boolean isHighCard(Card card)
      Checks if a card is considered a high card. High cards are typically those with a higher chance of winning a trick.
      Parameter:
      card - The card to check.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the card is a high card, false otherwise.

    • findHighestCardInSuit

      public static Card findHighestCardInSuit(ArrayList<Card> cards, Suits suit)
      Finds the highest card of a specific suit from a list of cards.
      Parameter:
      cards - The list of cards to search through.
      suit - The suit to search for the highest card.
      Gibt zurück:
      The highest card of the specified suit, or null if no such card is found.

    • getHighestValueCard

      public static int getHighestValueCard(HandCards handCards, int card1, int card2)
      Determines the card with the higher value from two given cards. If one of the cards has an invalid value (-1), the other card is returned. If both cards have an invalid value, -1 is returned.
      Parameter:
      handCards - The hand cards used to determine the value.
      card1 - The ID of the first card.
      card2 - The ID of the second card.
      Gibt zurück:
      The ID of the card with the higher value, or -1 if both cards are invalid.

    • getLowestValueCard

      public static int getLowestValueCard(HandCards handCards, int card1, int card2)
      Determines the card with the lower value from two given cards. If either of the cards has an invalid value (-1), the other card is returned.
      Parameter:
      handCards - The hand cards used to determine the value.
      card1 - The ID of the first card.
      card2 - The ID of the second card.
      Gibt zurück:
      The ID of the card with the lower value.

    • findHighestCardInRange

      public static int findHighestCardInRange(HandCards handCards, int start, int end, int[] passedCards)
      Finds the highest card within a specified range in a hand that has not been passed yet.
      Parameter:
      handCards - The hand cards to search through.
      start - The starting value of the range (inclusive).
      end - The ending value of the range (inclusive).
      passedCards - An array containing cards that have already been passed.
      Gibt zurück:
      The ID of the highest card in the range, or -1 if no card is found.

    • findLowestCardInRange

      public static int findLowestCardInRange(HandCards handCards, int start, int end, int[] passedCards)
      Finds the lowest card within a specified range in a hand that has not been passed yet.
      Parameter:
      handCards - The hand cards to search through.
      start - The starting value of the range (inclusive).
      end - The ending value of the range (inclusive).
      passedCards - An array containing cards that have already been passed.
      Gibt zurück:
      The ID of the lowest card in the range, or -1 if no card is found.

    • alreadyPassed

      public static boolean alreadyPassed(int[] bestCardsToPass, int card)
      Checks if a specific card has already been selected for passing.
      Parameter:
      bestCardsToPass - An array with cards that have been selected for passing.
      card - The card to check.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the card has already been selected for passing, false otherwise.

    • countSuitsWithCards

      public static SuitCount countSuitsWithCards(HandCards currentHandCards)
      Counts the number of cards belonging to each suit in the current hand. This method assumes that the deck is evenly divided into the four suits.
      Parameter:
      currentHandCards - The current hand cards of the player.
      Gibt zurück:
      A SuitCount object containing the count of cards for each suit.
